intro: Mussaenda esquirolii, commonly known as the golden trumpet bush, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange inflorescences that resemble trumpets. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces small, white flowers that develop into red, fleshy berries. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Mussaenda esquirolii is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
